conclusion: Analyze the forces acting on the wire in the magnetic field and their effect on spring scale readings.
Identify gravitational and magnetic forces acting on the wire.
Magnetic force depends on current direction.
Magnetic force on wire is given by F_B = I L B.
Magnetic field is perpendicular to the plane, so θ = 90°.
When current flows from a to b, magnetic force acts downward.
When current is reversed, magnetic force acts upward.
For current I from a to b, total downward force is F_1 = (W + I L B) / 2.
For current 2I from b to a, total downward force is F_2 = (W - 2I L B) / 2.
From first case: 2F_1 = W + I L B.
From second case: 2F_2 = W - 2I L B.
